properties.name: Edison Concert & Fireworks
properties.description: July 4, The 4th of July show will prove to be a real blast as 60’s-70s multi-hit super group the Grass Roots headline Papaianni Park.  “Midnight Confessions,” Temptation Eyes,” “Sooner or Later,” and “Wait a Million Years” are just a few of their 13 solid gold singles.A warm-up act will start off the concert at 5:30 p.m. At 7:30 p.m., the Grass Roots will entertain the thousands expected to attend.  Following the show, at 9 p.m., Garden State Fireworks will provide an Independence Day spectacular in the skies over Lake Papaianni. In case of inclement weather, the concert will be held inside at Edison High School.]]>

properties.name: Fairfield Fireworks
properties.description: July 4, (rain date July 5) At Jennings Beach, South Benson Road. Admission for non-residents is $25 per car. For information, call  203-256-3144.]]>

properties.name: Glen Cove Fireworks
Greenwich Fireworks
properties.description: July 5 (rain date July 6)The Department of Parks and Recreation announces the locations for the two Town Fireworks Displays in celebration of Independence Day. For the third consecutive year, the Town will present displays at Binney Park and Greenwich Point Park in Greenwich, CT. Both shows begin at dusk.The Point will be closed when the maximum number of cars for the available parking spaces has been achieved. Tailgating will not be permitted in Greenwich Point's Parking Lots during and after the display. Cooking is allowed only in regularly designated areas. The fireworks display will be fired from the corner of Greenwich Point well beyond the South Concession Stand. A limited area of the Point will be restricted from public use on the day of the fireworks. People interested in walking the Point will find a path detour in the Bluff Point Area of the Park. There will be many areas at Greenwich Point, including the main beach, which will offer exciting views of the dazzling colors that fill the sky. The Sound Beach Community Band will once again play before the Binney Park display. Information sheets on the Greenwich Point display are available at the Greenwich Point Ticket Booth.]]>

properties.name: Rye Playland Fireworks
properties.description: July 4, Fireworks displays over Long Island Sound will take place at Playland Park in Rye at 9:30 P.M. There will also be a display on Thursday, July 3, at 9:30 p.m. The park’s operating schedule is available on the Playland Web site or calling (914) 813-7010. Admission to Playland is always free. Parking is $5 on non-holiday weekdays, $7 on weekends, and $10 on July 4.Playland is located in Rye and can be reached via the New England Thruway (I-95), Playland Parkway exit 19. Follow this directly into Playland. ]]>

properties.name: Southampton Fireworks
properties.description: July 4 (rain date July 6),  21st Annual American Picnic With Grucci Fireworks For The Benefit Of The Southampton Fresh Air. A fabulous Grucci fireworks display, orchestrated with patriotic music, will once again be bursting in air over the Shinnecock Bay. The highly anticipated family tradition for children of all ages will include a picnic buffet; carts filled with popcorn, ice cream, hot dogs and all-American treats; arts and crafts, and carnival booths with games and prizes, all on the private grounds of an ocean-front estate. 7:00 PM-10:00 PM1030 Meadown LaneSouthamptonIndividual Tickets for Adults $250; Juniors (age 20-30): $100; Children (19 and under): $75. Benefactor Tickets: 10 Tickets at a reserved table ($15,000).For ticket information, please call 631-283-5847 or email Laura Devinney at ldevinney@sfah.org.]]>

properties.name: Toms River Fireworks
properties.description:
July 4, (rain date July 5) Beachwood will be having its 68th annual fireworks display. The fireworks will be launched from Beachwood's waterfront over the Toms River. The Beachwood Council claims that the display is the second largest in the area.
The Show will begin at Dusk, approximately 8:45 PM and should last 30 minutes. You can call (848) 992-3809 (Beverly Clayton) for more information.]]>
